3) There was evidence of publication bias, indicating the meta-analysis may be overestimating the true effect size. More studies are needed to confirm whether the one-third risk reduction claim holds. 

In summary, while antihypertensives provide some cardiovascular protection in hemodialysis patients, especially hypertensives, the evidence does not clearly support a one-third risk reduction claim applying to all such patients. The true effect is likely more modest based on the current evidence. Additional high quality randomized trials in this population are warranted.
